data.text: @jeffreytumlin please please do the same at 8th and Mission.  Between the large camp there, a covid clinic across the street, and the bus lane/stop obscuring visibility, it is one of the most dangerous navigations for pedestrians, esp. disabled ones who can't move quickly.
@jeffreytumlin Make the Jrun more efficiently please it’s not consistent
@gratifihouston @jeffreytumlin Red arrow is where Houston drivers make right turns now. Without stopping or looking straight ahead. Very dangerous! https://t.co/3DWWdtKHAG
@jeffreytumlin @AgustinOrozcoL This looks like the Dutch intersection  you mentioned. Seeing a live version in action really shows how it works. https://t.co/58PLfNa0WW

@AsiansStandup @jeffreytumlin Ooh which highway are they converting? 
Please say Bay Bridge is getting a walk/bike lane!!
@jeffreytumlin What’s the logic behind the flexi posts / speed bumps for the protection island? Truck turn radius?
@jeffreytumlin Bollards to stop cars & trucks from driving into the bike way would be a great next step! Thank you!
